text: When Enoch was sixty-five years old, he begot Methuselah.

The Philistines abandoned their gods there, and David and his men carried them away.

Along with one hundred thousand persons they also captured their livestock: fifty thousand camels, two hundred fifty thousand sheep, and two thousand donkeys.

But if they are not a guilty nation, then let my lord keep his distance; otherwise their Lord and God will shield them, and we will be mocked in the eyes of all the earth.”
Simon went into Galilee and fought many battles with the Gentiles. They were crushed before him,

Indeed, the ways of each person are plain to the LORD’s sight; all their paths he surveys;
Well-aimed bolts of lightning will go forth and from the clouds will leap to the mark as from a well-drawn bow;
Ah! Those who are wise in their own eyes, prudent in their own view!
Pay attention to this, you foolish and senseless people, Who have eyes and do not see, who have ears and do not hear.
Bring us back to you, LORD, that we may return: renew our days as of old.

For just as the Father raises the dead and gives life, so also does the Son give life to whomever he wishes.
